definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: There will be twenty or so people at the party.
sentences.chinese: 大約會有二十人蔘加派隊。

sentences.english: Extra staff were deployed last night at the Lok Ma Chau and Huanggang checkpoints.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚落馬州和皇崗口岸都加派人手。

sentences.english: We shall have to pat more doctors on the physical examination of new students.
sentences.chinese: 我們有必要加派醫生爲新生進行體格檢查。

sentences.english: We shall have to put on more doctors and nurses for the physical examination of new students.
sentences.chinese: 我們有必要加派醫生和護士爲新生進行體格檢查。

sentences.english: An extra 400 soldiers have been drafted in.
sentences.chinese: 現在已經加派了400名士兵。

definition: (of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
